question: A company invited 47 people to a luncheon, _____. If the tables they had held 5 people each, how many tables do they need?
A group of 3 friends went into a restaurant. _____. If they each got the same amount how many would each person get?
Tiffany baked 8 brownies, _____. If she used 8 cups of flour on each one, how much cups of flour does she still need?
Haley and her friends were recycling paper for their class. For every 3 pounds they recycled they earned one point. _____ and her friends recycled 16 pounds, how many points did they earn?
Mike is at the library helping put away books. There are 82 book to put away total but a librarian takes 10 of them and leaves Mike with the rest. _____, how many shelves will he need?
There were 4 friends playing a video game online when 5 more players joined the game. _____, how many lives did they have total?
Rachel bought two coloring books. _____ and the other had 39. After one week she had already colored 4 of the pictures. How many pictures does she still have to color?
At the fair Kaleb bought 6 tickets. _____. If each ticket cost 9 dollars, how much money did Kaleb spend riding the ferris wheel?
Isabel baked 3 brownies, _____. If she used 5 cups of flour on each one, how much cups of flour does she still need?
Gwen bought two coloring books. _____ and the other had 39. After one week she had already colored 13 of the pictures. How many pictures does she still have to color?
Frank was collecting cans for recycling. On Saturday he filled 5 bags up and _____. If each bag had 5 cans in it, how many cans did he pick up total?
Faye was playing a video game where she scores 7 points for each treasure she finds. _____ and 6 on the second, what would her score be?
A new building needed 9 windows. _____. If it takes 6 hours to install each window, how long will it take him to install the rest?
While on vacation, Rachel took 6 pictures at the zoo and _____. If she later deleted 11 of the pictures, how many pictures from her vacation did she still have?
A pet store had 41 siamese cats and _____. During a sale they sold 15 cats. How many cats do they have left?
While playing at the arcade, Frank won 33 tickets playing 'whack a mole' and _____. If he was trying to buy candy that cost 6 tickets a piece, how many could he buy?
A florist had 5 roses. _____ and then later picked 34 more, how many roses would she have?
Sam invited 9 friends to a birthday party, _____. If he wanted to buy enough cupcakes so each person could have exactly 2, how many should he buy?
For a birthday party George bought 10 regular sodas and _____. If his fridge would only hold 4 on each shelf, how many shelves would he fill up?
Frank had 11 dollars. _____. If he got another 14 dollars for his allowance, how much money does he have now?
George was working as a sacker at a grocery store where he made 5 dollars an hour. _____ and on Tuesday he worked 2 hours. How much money did George make in those two days?
Kaleb was collecting cans for recycling. On Saturday he filled 4 bags up and _____. If each bag had 4 cans in it, how many cans did he pick up total?
A new building needed 11 windows. _____. If it takes 8 hours to install each window, how long will it take him to install the rest?
A book store had 4 books in the bargin bin. _____, but then put 10 more in the bin, how many books would be in the bin?
Each chocolate bar in a box cost $3. _____ and Olivia sold all but 4 bars, how much money would she have made?
For the school bake sale Wendy made pastries. She baked 41 cupcakes and _____. After the sale she had 32 to take back home. How many pastries did she sell?
For the school bake sale Katie made 26 cupcakes. _____ and then made 20 more, how many cupcakes would she have?
The schools debate team had 11 boys and _____. If they were split into groups of 7 how many groups could they make?
While shopping for music online, Isabel bought 6 country albums and _____. Each album came with a lyric sheet and had 9 songs. How many songs did Isabel buy total?
Debby had 30 coloring books. _____, but then bought 35 more, how many would she have total?
For homework Amy had 18 math problems and _____. If she can finish 4 problems in an hour how long will it take her to finish all the problems?
Vanessa and her friends were recycling paper for their class. For every 9 pounds they recycled they earned one point. _____ and her friends recycled 16 pounds, how many points did they earn?
In a video game, each enemy defeated gives you 7 points. _____ and you destroy all but 8 of them, how many points would you earn?
Zoe and her friends were recycling paper for their class. For every 8 pounds they recycled they earned one point. _____ and her friends recycled 23 pounds, how many points did they earn?
Amy had 26 music files and _____. If she deleted 48 of the files, how many files were still on her flash drive?
Dave had to wash 29 short sleeve shirts and _____. If he had only washed 35 of them by the time school started, how many did he not wash?
Wendy uploaded 45 pictures to Facebook. _____ and put the rest into 9 different albums. How many pictures were in each album?
Wendy picked 103 flowers for her friend’s wedding. _____. If 47 of the flowers wilted before the wedding, how many bouquets could she still make?
Oliver was organizing his baseball cards in a binder with 3 on each page. _____ and 10 old cards to put in the binder, how many pages would he use?
A trivia team had 14 members total, _____. If each member that did show up scored 5 points, how many points were scored total?
Haley baked 20 cupcakes for her school's bake sale. If her brother, Todd, _____
Cody bought 7 boxes of chocolate candy and _____candy. If each box has 8 pieces inside it, how much candy did he have total?
Each chocolate bar in a box cost $4. _____ and Vanessa sold all but 7 bars, how much money would she have made?
Bianca picked 23 carrots from her garden. _____ and then picked 47 more the next day, how many carrots would she have total?
The school cafeteria ordered 33 red apples and _____. But, if only 21 students wanted fruit, how many extra did the cafeteria end up with?
At a restaurant each adult meal costs $7 and kids eat free. _____ and 9 were kids, how much would it cost for the group to eat?
Adam bought 13 boxes of chocolate candy and _____. If each box has 6 pieces inside it, how many pieces did Adam still have?
Each chocolate bar in a box cost $6. _____ and Zoe sold all but 6 bars, how much money would she have made?
Roger had 68 dollars. _____, how many 7 dollar toys could he buy with the money he had left?
For the school bake sale Amy made pastries. She baked 15 cupcakes and _____. After the sale she had 12 to take back home. How many pastries did she sell?
For the school bake sale Robin made 42 cupcakes. _____ and then made 39 more, how many cupcakes would she have?
Haley's favorite band was holding a concert where tickets were 4 dollars each. _____ and her friends and 5 extra tickets in case anyone else wanted to go. How much did she spend?
A company invited 45 people to a luncheon, _____. If the tables they had held 2 people each, how many tables do they need?
Roger was helping the cafeteria workers pick up lunch trays, but he could only carry 4 trays at a time. _____ and 2 trays from another, how many trips will he make?
Paul made 3 dollars mowing lawns and _____. If he only spent 3 dollar a week, how long would the money last him?
Edward was selling his old games. He started out with 35 but sold 19 of them. _____. How many boxes did he have to use?
A store had 120 coloring books in stock. They ended up putting them on sale and _____. The put the ones they still had onto shelves with 9 on each shelf. How many shelves did they use?
Katie had 7 pages of math homework and _____. If each page had 9 problems on it, how many problems did she have to complete total?
Tiffany was playing a video game and had 43 lives. _____. If she got 27 more lives in the next level, how many lives would she have?
Katie's team won their dodgeball game and scored 12 points total. _____ and everyone else scored 4 points each, how many players were on her team?
Wendy picked 45 flowers for her friend’s wedding. _____. If 35 of the flowers wilted before the wedding, how many bouquets could she still make?
At the fair there were 7 people in line for the bumper cars. _____ and left and 8 more got in line, how many people would be in line?
A pet store has 9 bird cages. _____ and 6 parakeets in it, how many birds does the pet store have total?
A pet store had 78 puppies. In one day they sold 30 of them and put the rest into cages with 8 in each cage. How many cages did they use?
Will had 59 pieces of clothing to wash. _____, but decided to split the rest into 9 equal loads. How many pieces of clothing could go in each of the small loads?
A magician was selling magic card decks for 2 dollars each. _____ and by the end of the day he had 3 left, how much money did he earn?
At the fair there were 12 people in line for the bumper cars. _____ and left and 15 more got in line, how many people would be in line?
A trivia team had 15 members total, _____. If each member that did show up scored 3 points, how many points were scored total?
At Tom's Restaurant a group with 2 adults and _____. If each meal cost 8 dollars, how much was the bill?
The cafeteria had 96 apples. For lunch they hand _____ and decided to use the rest to make pies. If each pie takes 6 apples, how many pies could they make?
Mike had 15 video games but 9 of them weren't working. _____, how much money could he earn?
Janet was playing a video game and had 47 lives. _____. If she got 46 more lives in the next level, how many lives would she have?

Oliver had 33 dollars in January. _____. If he got another 32 dollars from his mom, how much money would he have?
Gwen was organizing her book case making sure each of the shelves had exactly 4 books on it. _____ and 3 shelves of picture books, how many books did she have total?
Dave had 10 video games but 2 of them weren't working. _____, how much money could he earn?
Chloe was playing a video game where she scores 9 points for each treasure she finds. _____ and 3 on the second, what would her score be?
At lunch a waiter had 9 customers and _____. If he got $8 each from the ones who did tip, how much money did he earn?
There are 64 students trying out for the school's trivia teams. _____ and the rest were put into 4 groups, how many students would be in each group?
Paige picked 53 flowers for her friend’s wedding. _____. If 18 of the flowers wilted before the wedding, how many bouquets could she still make?
There were 6 girls and _____. If only 7 of them got called back, how many students didn't make the cut?
A teacher had 6 worksheets to grade. _____, but then another 18 were turned in, how many worksheets would she have to grade?
There are 58 students trying out for the school's trivia teams. _____ and the rest were put into 8 groups, how many students would be in each group?
Oliver had 35 dollars. _____. How much money does he have now?
Will had 83 dollars. _____, how many 4 dollar toys could he buy with the money he had left?
There school's baseball team had 12 new players and _____. If the coach put them into groups with 8 players in each group, how many groups would there be?
Luke had 48 dollars in January. _____. If he got another 21 dollars from his mom, how much money would he have?
A toy store had 4 giant stuffed bears in stock when they got another shipment with 10 bears in it. _____. How many shelves did they use?
At the arcade Victor won 46 tickets. _____ and later won 39 more tickets, how many would he have?
Carol and her mom were picking carrots from their garden. Carol picked 29 and _____. If only 38 of the carrots were good, how many bad carrots did they have?
Zoe had 42 bottles of water in her fridge. _____ and then bought 30 more, how many bottles would she have?
Maria was making baggies of cookies with 8 cookies in each bag. _____ and 19 oatmeal cookies, how many baggies could she make?
Bianca and her friends were recycling paper for their class. For every 3 pounds they recycled they earned one point. _____ and her friends recycled 3 pounds, how many points did they earn?
At a restaurant each adult meal costs $3 and kids eat free. _____ and 7 were kids, how much would it cost for the group to eat?
Wendy bought 4 new chairs and _____. If she spent 6 minutes on each piece furniture putting it together, how many minutes did it take her to finish?
There are 25 students trying out for the school's trivia teams. _____ and the rest were put into 2 groups, how many students would be in each group?
Will was working as a sacker at a grocery store where he made 8 dollars an hour. _____ and on Tuesday he worked 2 hours. How much money did Will make in those two days?
While playing a trivia game, Adam answered 5 questions correct in the first half and _____. If each question was worth 5 points, what was his final score?
The cafeteria had 47 apples. For lunch they hand _____ and decided to use the rest to make pies. If each pie takes 4 apples, how many pies could they make?
A pet shelter had 3 puppies when another 3 were brought in. _____, how long would it take for all of them to be adopted?
